data.title: How to watch the ‘Big Brother’ eviction tonight (8/8/24): FREE live stream, time, channel
data.meta_description: Cedric Hodges nominated Angela Murray, Kenney Kelley and Tucker Des Lauriers for eviction.
data.text:
Who will be the third person evicted on season 26 of “Big Brother”?

Head of household Cedric Hodges had nominated Angela Murray, Kenney Kelley and Tucker Des Lauriers for eviction on Thursday.

“Big Brother” airs at 8 p.m. Thursday, Aug. 8, 2024, on CBS.

LIVE STREAM: Fans can watch CBS without cable onfuboTV (free trial), DirecTV Stream (free trial) and Paramount+ (free trial).

On Wednesday, Des Lauriers won the power of veto and used it to remove not himself but Murray. Hodges named Makensy Manbeck to replace her on the eviction block. But, Manbeck had the “America’s Veto” in her pocked and used it to remove herself.

Ainsley the AI said America will vote on the replacement nominee tonight right before the AI Arena competition.

The first two houseguests evicted this season were Matt Hardeman and Lisa Weintraub.

“‘Big Brother’ follows a group of people living together in a house outfitted with more than 90 cameras and 100 microphones, recording their every move 24 hours a day. Each week, someone will be voted out of the house, with the last remaining houseguest receiving the grand prize of $750,000.”

Fans can watch the live feed inside the house onParamount+ with Showtime on their local CBS affiliate. Paramount+ Essential subscribers can watch the episodes on demand the day after they air.

The remaining houseguests are:

Angela Murray, 50, Syracuse, Utah, real estate agent

Brooklyn Rivera, 34, Dallas, Texas, business administrator

Cam Sullivan-Brown, 25, Bowie, Maryland, physical therapist

Cedric Hodges, 21, Boise, Idaho, former Marine

Chelsie Baham, 27, Rancho Cucamonga, California, nonprofit director

Joseph Rodriguez, 20, Tampa, Florida, video store clerk

Kenney Kelley, 52, Boston, Massachusetts, retired undercover cop

Kimo Apaka, 35, Hilo, Hawaii, mattress sales rep

Leah Peters, 26, Miami, Florida, VIP cocktail server

Makensy Manbeck, 22, Houston, Texas, construction project manager

Quinn Martin, 25, Omaha, Nebraska, nurse recruiter

Rubina Bernabe, 35, Los Angeles, California, event bartender

T’kor Clottey, 23, Atlanta, Georgia, crochet business owner

Tucker Des Lauriers, 30, Brooklyn, New York, marketing and sales executive

What is fuboTV?

FuboTV is a streaming service that offers more than 100 live and on-demand channels and includes cloud DVR. FuboTV has a seven-day free trial. Channels include AMC, E!, HGTV, ESPN, NBC Sports, NFL Network, FS1, MSNBC, Food Network, Great American Living, Magnolia Network, Animal Planet, Bravo, FX, CMT, Comedy Central and Hallmark. The Pro plan is $74.99 a month, Elite is $84.99 a month and Premier is $94.99 a month. Add-ons include EPIX, Showtime and Starz.

What is Paramount+?

Paramount+ streaming service includes CBS, BET, Comedy Central, Nickelodeon, MTV and Smithsonian Channel along with sports and originals. The Paramount+ Essential Plan is $5.99 a month or $59.99 for a year. The Paramount+ with Showtime bundle is $11.99 a month or $119.99 a year. Paramount+ offers a seven-day free trial.

What is DirecTV Stream?
